Hmmm ... all we do is call the interface that causes exit 23.

Nick, could you guys please take a look at this one? I do not think we can be 
doing anything that would cause the workbench to fail this way. We are just 
calling the restart API.

We were missing a null check on the decorator manager.
We were getting lucky since the Navigator, Search and most of the JDT views 
call getDecoratorManager() which lazy-initializes the field.

With Jeem's steps, the new workspace should be in the Resource perspective, 
which contains the Navigator.  This should also be true on restart, so I don't 
see how the NPE was getting hit.

I suspect it was the second time around.  When restarting, it would come up in 
the install/update perspective.  Shutting down from here would hit the case 
since none of the views in this perspecive use the decorator manager.

Closing PR.
